alert.note: Alert for Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 29 at 3:48AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Rio Blanco`s basin in Naguabo. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 AM AST, Doppler radar and emergency management indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Radar-estimated rainfall totals from past rain is between 1 and 3 inches over the warned area. Excessive runoff from past and current rain will maintain Rio Blanco`s streamflow above flood stage. Emergency Management reported ongoing flooding along Rio Blanco`s banks, affecting road PR-191 near Sector Pitina, Barrio Florida in Naguabo. This road remains impassable. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
